intro: Rhodiola yushuensis, commonly known as the Yushu rhodiola, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant is well adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting cold and drought tolerance. It produces small, pink or white flowers during the summer months. Due to its rarity and unique ecological significance, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
